title: Sakanwa
author: Sakanwa
content: I was told after death people do travel to another place that they are not been known there to live before rapture. I want to know if there is any sure thing, because I don't believe in such.

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: I think it is safe to say that no one will be able to answer this question objectively, unless one of us comes back directly from death I guessPersonally I don't believe in reincarnation, it doesn't fit my culture or my beliefs. It's all about beliefs, people need to follow their intuitions and beliefs, I guess if reincarnation were made to match yours, it would be immediately familiar to you and you would believe in it without needing to think about it.There are probably users on this forum who will know how to develop the subject, because there are certainly users from regions where this belief is shared by at least a part of their population.I had met a man who was trying to always do good things around him (at least in his personal conception of goodness). I asked him where he got the strength to stay positive even in difficult times, and how he managed to remain courteous and friendly, even when he was confronted with rude or unfair people. He told me that he tried to keep a positive relationship with all people and animals, because he was afraid of being reincarnated as a rock in his next life. I still wonder if he was serious, or if he was joking, but in the end, it doesn't matter what the belief is, as long as it directs the believers in question to a healthy relationship with humanity, it is a positive gain for all humanity.

comments.author: Iadegbola34
comments.body: Many people believe in reincarnation based on personal experiences, spiritual or religious beliefs, or anecdotal accounts. Some also point to research on near-death experiences and past-life regression therapy as evidence for the existence of reincarnation. Ultimately, whether or not reincarnation is real is a matter of personal belief. While there is no scientific evidence to support the concept of reincarnation, it is a belief held by many people around the world and has played an important role in many cultures and religions throughout history.

comments.author: be.open
comments.body: Quote from: Sakanwa on March 04, 2023, 05:41:49 PMI was told after death people do travel to another place that they are not been known there to live before rapture. I want to know if there is any sure thing, because I don't believe in such.From the point of view of higher justice, reincarnation is not only possible, but inevitable. Simply because in the case of a single life, everyone should get an equal starting opportunity, and this is obviously not the case. But in terms of elementary common sense, you have to ask yourself - do I remember my previous life? And if the answer is "no", then the best choice would be to live your life as if it were the only one, without regard to reincarnation. Because if you do not remember your previous life, then in the next life you will not remember this one either. So what is the practical use of believing in reincarnation?

comments.body: I personally do not see a need for reincarnation. I see life as a whole. Our minds separated from each other, giving us the mere illusion of individual consciousness. But what are we really? The universe observing itself. A singularity, expanding and dividing into infinite pieces and rearranging into strange patterns, yet still puzzle pieces which fit the same puzzle.At the quantum level, our only differences are the quantifiable. No proton is different from another proton. No electron distinguishable from the other.
